title: Passport Delays to Persist, State Department Says, Even With More Staffing
sub_head: The department faces a backlog of 1.5 million to 2 million passport applications, and estimates turnaround times of 12 to 18 weeks
body:
As Americans look to resume international travel, the State Department is struggling to clear a backlog of passport applications that is frustrating some travelers, and an official said an increase in staffing won’t immediately resolve the delays.
Rachel Arndt, the department‘s assistant secretary for passport services, said there is currently a backlog of between 1.5 million and 2 million passport applications. “That is somewhat higher than what we would normally expect to see,” she said.
Ms. Arndt attributed the large backlog to the sudden swell in travel that has coincided with increased Covid-19 vaccination rates among Americans, and said staffing was rising to handle the applications.
“We are surging staff, both adjudicators and contractors, back into the office at agencies across the country as Covid restrictions ease,” Ms. Arndt said.
She said applicants wouldn’t see immediate decreases in processing times. Currently, the department’s estimated turnaround times are 18 weeks for a standard passport application and 12 weeks for an expedited application. Pre-pandemic, it took six to eight weeks for regular applications and two to three weeks for expedited ones.
